title: Domain 2.7: Explain common methods for securing mobile and embedded devices.
content:
🔒 Screen Locks

  • Facial Recognition 👁️: Unlock with face; fast and secure.
  • PIN Codes 🔢: Numeric lock; use longer, complex PINs.
  • Fingerprint ✋: Uses biometric data for quick access.
  • Pattern 🎨: Connect-the-dots lock; avoid simple shapes.
  • Swipe 👉: Basic and insecure — not recommended.

📱 Mobile Device Security Tools

  • Remote Wipes 🧹: Erase data if the device is lost or stolen.
  • Locator Apps 📍: GPS-based tracking for lost devices.
  • OS Updates 🔄: Keeps security patches current.
  • Device Encryption 🔐: Encrypts data to prevent unauthorized access.
  • Remote Backup ☁️: Cloud-based backup for data recovery.
  • Failed Login Restrictions 🚫: Locks after too many wrong attempts.
  • Antivirus/Anti-Malware 🛡️: Defends against malicious apps/files.

🌐 Network & Policy Security

  • Firewalls 🔥: Block unauthorized traffic to/from devices.
  • Policies and Procedures 🧾: Define security guidelines and user responsibilities.
  • BYOD vs. Corporate-Owned 💼: Set different rules for personal vs company devices.
  • Profile Security Requirements 🧬: Devices must meet certain standards before gaining access.

📡 Internet of Things (IoT)

Secure all smart devices using strong passwords, regular firmware updates, and by segmenting them on a separate network.
